partnership.translation[0].definitions[0: the state of being a partner in business
She’s gone into partnership with two local doctors.
I’ve been in partnership with her for five years.
partnership.translation[0].definitions[1: a business owned by two or more people
It’s one of the most successful partnerships in the country.
partnership.translation[0].definitions[2: a relationship between two people, organizations, or countries
Several youth charities have formed a partnership to help these homeless teenagers.
The close partnership between Britain and the US will continue.
partnership.translation[0].note_box[0].h: – Meaning 3: a relationship between two people, organizations, or countries
partnership.translation[0].note_box[0].s: They formed a partnership solely to enter the competition.
He has forged a highly successful partnership with the Dublin singer Frances Black.
Developing international partnerships is vital to our continued success.
Theirs is one of the most fruitful working partnerships in modern science.
The two companies have built up a close partnership over the past four years.
The agency tries to forge effective partnerships with communities and private businesses.
We are looking forward to a successful partnership.
It’s a good partnership and we think it’s going to get better.
They regard marriage as an equal partnership.
partnership.translation[1].definitions[0: a relationship between two people, organizations, or countries that work together
the partnership between US capital and Mexican labor
partnership.translation[1].definitions[1: the situation of working together in business
Biogen developed the drug, which is marketed in partnership with another company.
He went into partnership with the owner of a cement factory.
partnership.translation[1].definitions[2: a business organization made up of a group of accountants, lawyers etc who work together, or of a group of investors
the Canadian partnership of the accounting firm PriceWaterhouseCooper
Prime sold a 65% stake in Howard Johnson to aninvestment partnership for $200 million.
